The {{named req|TrivialClock}} requirements describe the requirements satisfied by several clocks in the [[cpp/chrono|chrono library]].

===Requirements===
For a type {{c|TC}}:
* The type must meet {{named req|Clock}} requirements.
* The types {{c|TC::rep}}, {{c|TC::duration}}, and {{c|TC::time_point}} satisfy the requirements of {{named req|EqualityComparable}}, {{named req|LessThanComparable}}{{rev inl|until=c++17|, {{named req|DefaultConstructible}}, {{named req|CopyConstructible}}, {{named req|CopyAssignable}}, {{named req|Destructible}}}}, {{named req|Swappable}}, and {{named req|NumericType}}.
* The function {{c|TC::now()}} does not throw exceptions.
* The type {{c|TC::time_point::clock}} meets the {{named req/core|TrivialClock}} requirements, recursively.

===Standard library===
The following types in the standard library satisfy {{named req/core|TrivialClock}} requirements:
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/chrono/dsc system_clock}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/chrono/dsc steady_clock}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/chrono/dsc high_resolution_clock}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/chrono/dsc file_clock}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/filesystem/dsc file_time_type}}
{{dsc end}}
